newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves via 9-day fixed system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves via 9-day fixed system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve added reserves into the banking system on Tuesday via 9-day system repurchase agreements, a New York Fed spokeswoman said.
The RPs are for fixed collateral, and follow the overnight and 6-day system RPs done on Thursday, before the Martin Luther King holiday on Monday.
The Fed's operation was generally unexpected. Analysts had figured the Fed would add via 2-day system RPs, with some predicting no action.
Fed funds were at 5-5/16 percent when the Fed entered the open market, sligthly above the 5-1/4 percent target.
